Name: Valda: Rise of the Giants
Description:
SUMMARY
Valda: Rise of the Giants is a an expansion to Valda. As in the base game, it is a power-building strategy game where you as a viking warchief use divine powers, manage a village and resources, play powerful spells and build temples. You gather followers, fight off enemies and climb the steps to divinity.

This expansion gives you the chance to discover the power of the Giants. 15 new cards for the base deck and 68 new Giant cards that offer you brand new powers with never before-seen graphics. A new powerful resource, 7 Giant powers, double sided action tokens and 5 new player boards complete this expansion.

STORY
All was peace and quiet in Asgard. The Gods continued being worshipped and led their easy immortal life. Until Hel, Queen of the Underworld wanted to broaden her empire. She seduces Surtur to form a powerful alliance. Thirsty for destruction Surtur calls his fellow brethren to reclaim their territory. After decades of hiding the Giants rise again. War is among us.

HOW TO PLAY (AND WIN)
In Valda: the Rise of the Giants, you now have a choice between Gods and Giants and their powers to use to your advantage. 
Now every player finishes 4 phases during their turn. The player starts with the Valda phase where he/she scavenge and explore the newly formed world by drafting and playing cards and actions. Building temples in the different God or Giant domains is an important way to gain divine abilities, and get access to more powerful spells. The attack phase is played similar to the base game. So every player can attack the player in turn once. In the follower phase you worship a God or Giant by building a temple in the specific God or Giant area. Resources (divine blood, gold, diamonds, runes), cards or (dice) eyes can be transferred into followers. In the last phase you roll dice to harvest rare resources for your tribe.

The viking chieftan who has the most followers when the ship arrives in Asgard, is worthy enough to climb the world tree Yggdrasil and becomes a God! Oh.. and he/she also wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Prêt Feu Go!
Description:
Prêt Feu Go is a friendly and festive game for your evenings with friends. The game is in French only.

Small format, very simple rules, unlimited number of players and lasting from 5 minutes to hours, it will adapt to all your events: dinners with friends, aperitifs on the terrace, WE in the countryside, team-buildings, rave-party, birthdays, weddings and bachelor(ette) parties!

The Chief asks 1 question to another player, who needs to give 3 answers within 5 seconds. If the player manages to give 3 or more correct answers during these 5 seconds: IT'S WON, he wins the question card which represents 1 point, and the next player is to answer.

Please note: the Chief is all-powerful and it is up to him to decide whether the answers given are accepted (especially for subjective questions!). Once all the players have been interviewed, the Chief chooses the player who will become the new Chief, and off you go for another round!

The winner is the first to get 6 points… or the player with the most points when you decide to end the game.

You will find six categories: Culture, Non censured, Your life-your point of view, France, unclassifiable, things.

Name: まじかる☆ベーカリー(Magical Bakery)
Description:
Players are apprentice wizards working in a magical bakery. They use magic spells and cooperation from other players to bake all of the ordered pastries.

Each turn, a player either looks at a baked good card or goes home early (placing one money in the center as a tip.) If they look at the baked good card, they can add it to the stack of orders to be fulfilled, or discard it and hide one of the eight notes with the magic spells on them.

When only one player remains, they attempt to bake all of the bread. Each bread card has a die combination that needs to be made. They only get a single roll, but the remaining spell cards  will help them reroll or manipulate the dice, and they can bribe other players to reroll the dice for them.

If a player succeeds, they earn the tip pool and the value of all of the items they baked. If they fail, they get nothing; the second time they fail, they are fired (eliminated from the game.)

The goal is to be the first to get to a set goal of money, or the last person still employed.

Name: Impractical Jokers the Game
Description:
Think you've got what it takes to be one of the Jokers? Now's your chance to put yourself to the test. In this three part game players first try and pull off challenges in front of unsuspecting guests. Once the gag is up, players then face off in a charades-like card game to see who can match the most awkward one liners in response to funny scenarios. The night's biggest loser is subject to a surprise punishment of epic proportions.

—description from the publisher

In the first part of this party game, each player is given a card that issues them some sort of awkward and funny challenge to complete in front of an unsuspecting person (nothing dangerous, gross or illegal, all challenges are silly and require no physical contact). The second phase of the game has players receiving cards with a scenario and the other players respond to this scenario with pre-written one-liners on cards of their own. Points are tallied from both phases and a loser is declared-- whoever has the least amount of points-- and this losing player receives a card that delivers them some sort of silly "punishment".

Note: This edition was a Walgreen exclusive.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Legendary Card Pack
Description:
The long anticipated set of cards that fixes a number of typos that have long plagued our community! The Legendary Card pack also includes everything you need to upgrade your 1.5 core game to 1.6. This includes some balance adjustments, some replaced cards and maaaaybe even a new card or two!

This Card pack includes:

     Card Typo Fixes for Core Game and Expansions
     Minor content needed to upgrade a 1.5 Core game to 1.6
     Promised content from selected single release figures
     Promised content from Pinups of Death II collection
     A surprise or two!


—description from the publisher

Name: Los nietos de Frankenstein
Description:
Roll the dice to get the different parts of your Franky: head, trunk, legs, arms, brain, heart and bring them to life with lightning! Is the missing piece not available? Well, maybe you can snatch it from another player. Use the tiles to save your created monsters and become Grandpa Frank's favorite grandson. A fast, simple and fun game for the whole family.

—description from the publisher (translated)
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Brazen Bat & Vixen Tail
Description: This is a set of Halloween Promo pattern cards and gear cards that were included with the Halloween Ringtail Vixen miniature.

Name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Echoes of Death 3
Description:
The Echoes of Death 3 custom box includes:

1 x Knight Survivor with scenic base insert
1 x Sniper Survivor  with scenic base insert
1 x Monk Survivor with scenic base insert
1 x Dark Paladin Survivor 
1 x Hard plastic 30mm insert
4 x Hard plastic 30mm bases
4 x Large matte print of the original concept artwork on heavy card stock
1 x prototype Strain Card rules sheet for adding to your campaign
4 x Strain Milestone cards
4 x Strain Fighting Arts
1 x Vermin Card
1 x Strain Fighting Arts card divider
1 x Strain Milestone card divider

Echoes of Death 3 includes 4 new survivors that embody memories from another world. These memories can be unlocked by reaching unique milestones in the story of your campaign.

This set includes prototypes of Strain System mechanics. Add your Strain Milestone cards to your game, if you reach their unique conditions, your gameplay changes forever. A new fighting art borne from distant dreams is permanently added to your game.

Name: Curious Cargo: Pre-Order Promos
Description:
Pre-order exclusives for the game Curious Cargo:

Additional double-sided player boards:
These player boards introduce the Rainbow Splitter which acts as a wild/joker connection point for your network! Look out for the P2 side of the player board: This layout only has a total of 4 connections to machines for shipping and receiving goods. Playing on this side will provide the most challenging experience, especially if you are playing with all 3 colors in the game!

Bus tile & card:
Time-warping in from another dimension, the BUS pays a visit to your facility! This is the largest vehicle in the game!

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Wrath of the Everchosen
Description:
The Great Necromancer, Nagash, initiates an all-out war to end all life in the Mortal Realms, but in order to complete his monumental task he needs access to them. And so he turns his gaze to the Eightpoints, ruled over by none other than Archaon Everchosen, Exalted Grand Marshall of the Apocalypse.

The vast armies of the dead, led by Nagash’s chief lieutenant, Katakros, march for the nigh-impenetrable fortress of Chaos – the Varanspire. Archaon does not take this challenge lightly, and seeks aid from a powerful force, long believed to be lost… But will it be enough to halt the legions of the dead?

Wrath of the Everchosen advances the story of Warhammer Age of Sigmar with Realm-shaking events that will have far-reaching consequences for many factions. You'll learn why Nagash needs to conquer the region to complete his infernal work, and watch the ebb and flow of the invasion as it progresses.

On top of the action-packed story, this book includes a painting guide, and enhanced rules for your Chaos Grand Alliance armies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hoch hinaus
Description:
Each player, if no more than 5, gets a red wooden disc. On your turn, place a white disc on the table if it is the first one. If not, stack it on the disc tower. When you think the tower will crash before it's your turn again, place a red disc. If it's your turn again, pay a chip. When the tower crashes, the player who caused it pays 4 chips, other players with still their red disc in possession pay 2. If you are out of chips, you're out of the game. The last player with chips wins.

—user summary

Name: Flick of Faith: Loki God Promo
Description:
Another contender joins the bet.
Loki can use Prophets and Temples of any other god currently not in the game.
Read the Laws, misslead others and trick them into the Law of your choice to earn VP!

This promo was created to celebrate Flick of Faith Essen Spiel'19 premiere.

-description from designer

Name: Dante Alighieri: Comedia – Inferno
Description:
The Divine Comedy by Dante Alighieri begins among the punishments of sins and ends with the beatitudes of virtues. Join Dante and Virgil in their journey through the Circles of Hell until... we again behold the stars.

Through a "spiral" draft, players must collect Encounter cards with different numbers (possibly just a single copy) in order to convert their value into Victory points at the end of the game. Character cards, on the other hand, are helpful support cards which give control certain mechanics but, at the end of the game, having the supremacy of the Characters penalizes in any tie-break for victory.

-description from publisher

Name: Concordia: Solitaria
Description:
A solo and 2-player expansion for Concordia by Mac Gerdts and Frank Lamprecht.
(14+ years, playtime approx. 60 min)

In CONCORDIA SOLITARIA you compete alone or in a team of two against the tricky opponent CONTRARIUS. As the cards you play also determine the reactions of your adversary, only skillful planning leads to victory. 
In a two player game you can either compete with CONTRARIUS as a cooperative team or challenge it individually.
CONCORDIA SOLITARIA may be played on any of the maps and with any other expansion for CONCORDIA.

Requires either the base game CONCORDIA or CONCORDIA VENUS to play.

Content:
72 cards, 4 dice and rules
Difficulties:
standard, veteran and expert

Name: DIG!
Description:
Super colorful HOWEVER an Icon-Driven card play design allows for 100% Colorblind Compatibility gameplay!

Fast play, quick card discovery action. Players bury (deal) piles of cards that contain various items, at increasing card values as the item itself is more valuable.

Players then search for these buried treasures, by using o of 4 different tools in the hand. the starting tool, as a Spoon and Fork, is the least likely digging apparatus! As such, you can peek at the top card in a pile with the spoon, and upon returning to that card on a later turn, DIG! it up with the fFork.

Players can upgrade their tools to DIG! faster by trading in found treasures for a Rake, Spade and Shovel. As players upgrade to these better tools, the no longer peek at piles, instead DIG! up cards right away.

Find more treasures per turn with each upgraded tool.... and avoid hidden bombs laced within the piles! Discover a bomb, loose your collected loot, and start your treasure collections all over again.

The player with the most treasure by the time all the piles are uncovered, wins!

With gameplay under 10 minutes, there is more than meets the eye. When do you upgrade? How many holes do you DIG! Can you avoid the bombs and leaving your opponent no other choices?

Fun, Fast, Gamer/NonGamer, All-Ages Excitement! 2 Players per deck, add a second deck for fully supported 4-player action.

-description from publisher

Name: Devil May Cry: The Bloody Palace – Devil Trigger Expansion
Description:
Are you ready to unleash your inner demons? Release that destructive power with the Devil Trigger expansion! Activate Devil Trigger to introduce incredible new forms and exciting new move sets for Dante, Nero, and Trish. Not to be left behind, V can summon his third and most powerful demonic familiar, Nightmare, to gain a new level of control over the battlefield. Plus, this expansion introduces additional rules to step up Lady’s game (The Walking Arsenal expansion), so she can compete with the Devil Trigger-enhanced Hunters (and the dreaded Nightmare)!

Contents:
    1x Sin Devil Trigger Nero mini
    1x Sin Devil Trigger Dante mini
    1x Sin Devil Trigger Trish mini
    1x Nightmare mini
    Over 80 cards
    All the tokens, markers, and gauges you need to play!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Devil May Cry: The Bloody Palace – The Alpha & The Omega Expansion
Description:
Bring a whole new level of carnage to your games of Devil May Cry™: The Bloody Palace with four terrifying new enemies! Brace yourself the spinning, spiked Chaos, and the bladed, teleporting Fury. Still hungry for more? Then take on two highly anticipated bosses! One is the power-hungry demon Urizen, the Usurper. The other is the most iconic boss enemy in Devil May Cry™ history— Vergil: the Alpha and the Omega.

Contents
    2x Fury minis
    1x Chaos mini
    1x Vergil mini
    1x Sin Devil Trigger Vergil mini
    1x Urizen mini
    Over 60 cards
    All the tokens and markers you'll need to play!

-description from publisher's website

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Necromantic Horror Team Card Pack
Description:
Redesigned with the Second Season ruleset in mind, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Necromantic Horror teams.

CONTENTS
– 5 Player reference cards for Zombie Linemen, Ghoul Runners, Wraiths, Flesh Golems, and Werewolves
– 3 Star Player cards for Frank ’n’ Stein, Wilhelm Chaney, and Bryce ‘The Slice’ Cambuel
– 8 Random Event Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 19 Blank Player cards: 11 Zombie Linemen, 2 Ghoul Runners, 2 Wraiths, 2 Flesh Golems, and 2 Werewolves
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You’ll need a copy of Blood Bowl: The Official Rules and Spike! Journal 11 to make full use of these cards.

Name: Blood Bowl: Second Season Edition – Special Plays Card Pack
Description:
This deck of 64 cards contains all of the universal Special Plays available to every team as inducements in the new edition of Blood Bowl, broken down into handy categories. You’ll also find reminder cards for the results of the Prayers to Nuffle table from the book.

You won’t find these Special Plays anywhere else, so make sure you secure a copy of this deck if you want to take advantage of these strategic inducements to help even the odds.

CONTENTS
– 8 Benefits of Training Special Play cards
– 8 Dirty Tricks Special Play cards
– 8 Heroic Feats Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 8 Miscellaneous Mayhem Special Play cards
– 8 Random Events Special Play cards
– 16 Prayers to Nuffle reminder cards

You’ll need a copy of Blood Bowl: The Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

Name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Necromantic Horror Team Pitch
Description:
Necromantic Horror teams are right at home amongst the macabre and supernatural. What better location for a stadium than within a Sylvanian graveyard? Necromancer coaches often try to convince their counterpart to begin playing just as daylight fades, hoping the chill of the night saps the other players’ strength and invigorates their own.

This double-sided board depicts a dusky, barren cemetery pitch on one side, replete with tombs and flagstone walkways, and littered with pumpkins, skulls, and freshly-dug open graves – ready for the next victim. On the other side, the same scene but after the sun has set, with eerie witchfire in the eyes of the pumpkins (and skulls!) and the Necromantic Horror icon in the center of the field.

The package includes two redesigned dugouts for the new edition of the game. They match the creepy dusk to dawn aesthetics of the pitch – each dugout featuring Score, Turn, and Re-roll trackers, plus Reserves, Knocked-out, and Casualty boxes. You'll also find rules to represent the particular features of both sides of the pitch.

Necromantic Horror teams are compatible with the 2016 Edition of Blood Bowl using the "Teams of Legend" optional rules published by Games-Workshop.

Name: Monopoly: Brugge
Description:
The Monopoly Brugge edition of the game remains true to the original concept but was given a Bruges look in terms of content and graphics. 
All locations are filled in with well-known streets, squares and sights of Bruges.

Not only the locations, but also the graphical design radiates Bruges. 
The box, the board and the properties are given a Bruges look & feel. 
Also, the Community Chest and Chance cards have not only been changed in terms of look and feel, but are also interspersed with numerous Bruges references.

Only 4000 made.

Name: LEO (400-800km)
Description:
Low Earth Orbit (LEO) is the most crowed area of space. 1000s of spacecraft pass overhead and orbit slots are hotly contested. Take control of your LEO spacecraft, manage its resources to deliver the maximum data back to the ground.

In LEO (400-800km) players take control of a spacecraft in Low Earth Orbit.  Each turn they move their spacecraft to the next orbit card and resolve the events on that card (discharge battery, damage memory, use thrusters to maintain orbit, place new orbit card).

After the events, the player can then take one of the following actions:

     Adjust orbit (either moving up to a higher orbit, or down to a lower orbit),
     Recharge battery,
     Activate instruments (storing science or image data in their memory area)
     Downlink data (remove science & image data from the memory area and score points on the science and image track)


As the game progresses players will be eliminated as they run out of fuel and can no longer maintain their orbit.
Once all players have been eliminated, the player with highest, lowest scoring track is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Catfight
Description:
Catfight is a very fast two-player card game in which players compete to have the strongest gang by trying to collect as many different cats as possible. Each turn, they draw two cards then either discard one card or lay down a set of cards. To lay down a set, you need at least two cards if the same gang member hasn't been played or more cards than are already on the table if it has been played. Any cards of the same gang member on the table are discarded. The round ends when one player has five different gang members, OR the draw pile is exhausted. When the draw pile is exhausted, players score for the different gang members they have laid down in front of them.

Just like in a fighting game, Catfight is played as "first-to-2", or I think it's also known as best of three.

—description from the designer

Name: Intime Conviction n°3: L'Affaire du bouchon de Liège
Description:
Sick prank or well-orchestrated vengeance? The gala just started and was going so well…

Jurors, will you make the right decision? Slip into the shoes of a juror, judge a criminal case and deliver your verdict. Play with friends for an evening by recreating the atmosphere of a closed session! Or make the fun last by revealing only a few items a day!

"Intime Conviction n°3: L’Affaire du bouchon de Liège is the third installment of the series of murder solving game by  Editions Fika  Intime conviction is a craft object entirely designed, made and assembled by hand and in Belgium. The format of the game is unusual as well: the whole game fits in an envelope.

- In group: Play with friends at a party by recreating the closed door ambiance (about 2h game)
- 2 player game: Make it last by revealing only a few new elements every day.

Place the crime scene in the middle of the table and give each player a Juror card.
Inspect the crime scene, then read the defendant's deposition. Reveal the Juror cards one by one.
When the Jury is ready to vote, the final vote takes place. If a majority isn't reached, the debate continues until someone switches sides.

The verdict is announced, a final revelation is unveiled (brand new information is discovered).
You win if you settled on the right decision. You lose if the verdict was inadequate.

—description of a distributor.

Name: Toy Story: Obstacles & Adventures – Promotional Pack
Description:
A set of 7 additional cards for Toy Story: Obstacles & Adventures.

Fun-Loving (Trait)
Mr. Mike (Friend)
Dramatic (Traint)
Rocket (Item)
Party Balloons (Item)
Bucket of Soliders (Item)
Evil Dr. Porkchop (Item)

Name: Evergreen Bandana Game
Description: The Evergreen Bandana Game is an adventure board game where players roll to race across the state. Along the way players will encounter unique Washington obstacles and have a chance to speed up their advancement when they risk a roll of the adventure dice. The game is comes printed on a durable cloth bandana.

Name: LOL: Le jeu
Description:
With over 500 comedic scenes inspired from the universe of the television series LOL ComediHa! ? to choose from, the players will have to recreate the scenes originally brought to life by the comedians.

The Judges team will have to guess whatever it is that they are trying to act out. 
If they can figure out what were the given scene keywords, both the team who mimed and the Judges will get points. 
Important note: additional points will be awarded to the team who gave the best performance, so give it everything you’ve got!

—description from the publisher

Once every team has had a turn as the Judges, the game ends. The team with the most points wins!

Be ready to laugh out loud!

Name: Activity Solo & Team
Description: 2 versions in 1 box of this famous party game: You can either play in teams or each play against all the others.

Name: Activity Knock Out
Description:
Who is never at a loss of words?
The players role the die to determine the letters which can be used to create words to be found. The challenge lies in the fact that the time one team needs to write down the words can be used by the other team to find the words.

Name: Bull's Eye
Description: Fast reaction game! The player who picks up the correct cards first wins.

Name: Tick Tack Bumm Vibrations
Description: This is a guessing game for adults. The challenge is that you get a red bomb which can explode at any time.

Name: Die Stinkies: Rette sich, wer kann!
Description: Roll the dice as fast as you can and move your tokens accordingly. If you are too slow, the car wash will wet you and you loose.

Name: Stolpersteig
Description: Stumbling blocks are all over the place! Every player has 8 tokens to find his way to the castle. But since there are many obstacles, such as stones, water or canyons, it's a real challenge to be the first one in the castle...

Name: Cars Angelspiel
Description: Fishing game with the famous cars from the movie! Help Hook to tow away the corresponding cars.

Name: scene it?
Description: More than 70 years of soccer history in one quiz game! You watch a film clip randomly chosen and answer some questions about the world championships till 2006.

Name: Wasser marsch!
Description: Willy Water, the friendly fire hydrant, is very busy: There is fire threatening the zoo, the cinema, the theme parc and the toys store. All children blow as much as they can to save the city.

Name: Das grosse Musikquiz
Description: The quiz game from Abba to ZZ Top, from rock to pop! The game is based on Germany's famous music show and features 528 music questions.

Name: Galileo Wissens-Quiz
Description: Quiz game based on the famous TV show Galileo. Test your knowledge and win!

Name: Bares für Rares: das Spiel zur Trödel-Show!
Description:
How much is the old vase? How much can I offer in order to persuade the dealers of my rare piece? 
The players really feel like in the famous TV show. They have some rare pieces to sell and get support by the experts.

Name: Hexerei
Description:
"I am the strongest", shouts the witch and chases away the dog. But she didn't count on the mouse - in order to get away from the mouse she has to take to her heels!
The spinning dice swirl around until all players have decided on a figure. But who is chasing away whom? As a reward for guessing right, you get tidbit cards. A guessing game.
—description from the back of the box

The mechanism is similar to rock-paper-scissors. The children must guess what the others might take and take the better one. 
—user summary

Name: Waldfreunde
Description: Friends of the forest: On your marks, ready, steady, go! The quirrel, hare, deer and bear are having an exciting competition. They whizz along the bushes and trees as as fast as the wind. But what is happening there? A bush is moving! Which animal doesn't get confused and wins the race?

Name: Pizza-Pizza
Description: Pineapple, cheese, tomatoes and many other delicious ingredients are to be put onto the pizza. But one kid has hidden the ingredients carefully: The tomatoes in the bookshelf, the mushroom behind a plant, the salami below the table... The others must rush to find all the items. The first one wins.

Name: Ratz Fatz Weltreise: Mau Mau
Description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers around the world.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

Name: Ratz Fatz Piraten: Mau Mau.
Description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers within the pirates world.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

Name: Ratz Fatz Pferde: Mau Mau
Description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers who love horses.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

Name: Memo Rondo
Description:
Funny animal cards are distributed in a circle on eight places. They are shown to all players before they are hidden.
An open card is put on top of each covert card. The arrow card in the middle determines two piles, of which at least one of the two cards below must be guessed.

—user summary

Name: Tri-Memo
Description:
The game is played like a classic memo, in which each player tries to collect as many pairs as possible by revealing them. Only with TRI-MEMO there are other variations that also require concentration and strategy, but also bring fun, excitement and - yes, also malicious joy.

Instead of finding two identical cards, you need to find a pair of two cards that are two halves of one picture.

Name: ELEKTRICO
Description: A roll & write game in which our task is to power a bizarre machine constructed by a mad scientist. In each of the 8 rounds of the game, a set of dice are used to strengthen selected connections. At the end of each round, players choose how the scoring will work, the choice is very important because the same connections will be run several times during the game. The game provides intense intellectual gameplay and a lot of combinations.

Name: Vermot: le grand tournoi
Description:
Vermot: le grand tournoi for the fan of the Vermot and passionate about French popular culture.

The Vermot is now available in the form of a board game.

Roll the dice and test your knowledge of the Vermot universe in a course strewn with pitfalls.
320 cards containing more than 600 questions divided into 6 sections: History, Sport, Humor, Leisure, Science and health, Society.

Game play:
roll the dice and advance your pawn on a 30-day calendar board dotted with bonus spaces. Whoever fills their calendar first wins.

Name: MonsDRAWsity: Cute Creatures
Description:
More monsters have been spotted! The cute expansion is the first in our line of thematic expansions for MonsDRAWsity that will add more cards to keep the game fresh!

- Expansion for MonsDRAWsity with thematic new monsters
- Gives you more games, new cards, and an extra player board to expand it to 9 players!
- Adds cute monsters that are simpler to describe to make the game even more accessible for kids!

Name: MAST BUY
Description:
MAST BUY is an auction game where the players are athletes in a yacht race and must purchase the masts they will use.

The "masts" in the game consist of a set of small wooden dowels between 120mm and 160mm in 5 mm increments, with multiple of each size.  Each player starts the game with 50 money, marked on a board, a random mast, and a blue stone.

On a turn, a player chooses a mast, blindly, from the game box to put up for auction.  The auction proceeds around the table with each player making a pass or bidding and the last player to place a bid winning the mast.

The game ends when a player has won a certain number of masts, four of the same size, or is out of money.

If a player has collected four of the same size, they immediately win.  Otherwise, players earn points for the number of masts they have in sequential size order (5 mm apart), with duplicates of a size adding no additional points.  Players also earn points for money that they did not spend.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: Maximum Apocalypse: Redhead
Description:
Promotional Redhead character card deck and miniature based on The Few & Cursed graphic novel for use in Maximum Apocalypse.

Included as part of The Few and Cursed: Deluxe Expansion.

Name: Quiz For Friends
Description:
Play with your friends and family.
Start with the question "who ...?" And ask the questions written on the cards. Put your friends and family into precarious situations and find out what they really think about you!

There are 2 play options:
1- Everyone plays individually, each player writes down the name of the player they think matches the most the description. If your name has the most votes, you get the card.

2 - Divide the group into teams of 2 to 4 players. All members of one team receive 1 answer card and a marker. A player from the other team draws a card and reads it aloud. The players in the group with the answer cards write down the name of the player that fits the most. They are NOT allowed to communicate. At the end of the hourglass, the players turn their cards around. If they all wrote the same name, they win the card. The group with most cards at the end wins.

Name: ALPAKALAND
Description: Our task in the game is to design a theme park with alpacas. We have to build buildings, homesteads, roads. Then place different species of alpacas so that the park is as attractive to visitors as possible. In each round we receive random resources from the dice which we have to use properly.

Name: MIXTURE
Description: You are a student of the alchemist school. It is time for the final exam. Your task is to use the available ingredients to create a top-rated potion. In each round, you use a dice throw to choose the ingredients which you then throw at the right places on the board so as not to block your movements in future rounds. A lot of combination and interesting mechanics hidden in simple rules

Name: Hero Mail
Description:
Hero Mail is a cooperative or solo playable push your luck and resource management game in which you play local superheroes who must protect their city from a villain with sinister plans. The whole game fits on a postcard and there are different postcards for different cities with unique mechanics.

The game runs in 2 phases. In the first phase the heroes try to stop the villain's plans before he becomes too strong. The villain first collects threat markers based on the behaviour of the heroes in the last round and the current scenario. These are distributed to the different plans. Then the Heroes can recharge and use their abilities by forming 2 pairs from 4 dice rolled and taking an action marker with the corresponding number. If the number is no longer available, it cannot be taken. And if no available or already taken number is rolled and the dice cannot be manipulated with the hero's abilities, the hero loses all markers collected in this round. Heroes can decide to end their turn at any time, in which case they may use their markers to prevent the villain's plans, reduce damage or recharge their abilities. Once all heroes have finished their turn, the villain's unresolved plans are handled and his power increases according to the heroes' behaviour.
When all plans have been foiled or the villain has become too strong, it comes to the grand finale, in which the heroes must defeat the villain. The heroes must complete tasks based on the action markers they have placed during the course of the game.

This game was designed during the second corona wave and has several free to download scenarios, to bring some boardgames to everybody during the social distance time. You can also send the postcard with game to your game playing friends and Relatives. You can also support your local game store with this game, as there are several special scenario postcards, which are exclusive available in local game stores.

—description from the designer

Name: Mage Forge
Description: In the game we run a magic forge whose goal is to create magical objects. Using a common resource of dice, each player tries to create and improve items so that they finally have the most power. The game requires long-term planning and sensible resource management.In each round, players have 6 dice at their disposal to give magical properties to the objects: they increase their power, unlock the colors of magic, upgrade, and finally create the magical dust necessary to complete the project.  After 7 turns, all players compare the collections of created items. The winner is the player whose items are the most powerful

Name: Last Species
Description:
A triangle board contains 121 tiles, you control 3 rescuers of the WWF association. You will have to move, explore the jungle and the oceans in order to find the 7 last endangered species before your opponent. You will have to use cleverly all objects you pick up when you move upon tiles to put all chances to your side.

—user summary

Name: Escape Room: The Game – Challenge
Description:
You've been captured by a mad genius. He'll let you go only if you prove yourself worthy! Solve as many puzzles as you can in ten minutes and hope you'll survive! Play by yourself or in a team and deal with the pressure of solving riddles and puzzles while time is ticking away...

Escape Room: The Game – Challenge consists of a deck of 24 cards and decoder card. Each card has double-sided riddles and an answer obfuscated behind a red/blue filter. You can play solo and try to see how many you can get in ten minutes, and that's your score.

You can play cooperatively in teams and race the other team drawing from the common deck. There's a decoder card to check your answer.
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Prehistories: Shield
Description:
Prehistories: Shield is a set of five hunter cards — one for each player — with a shield symbol on the card. Shuffle this card into your deck at the start of the game, and play it with other cards when placing a bid during a round. When you play it, this card ensures that you will not be injured during the hunt phase.

This mini-expansion, which will be distributed in board game stores, is a tribute to Benoit Turpin's uncle Jo, who passed away during the graphic development of the game.

The English version was available via Tantrum House Season 8 Kickstarter.

Name: Survivor Challenge
Description:
Survivor Challenge is a card game in which you can playfully get fit! Challenge yourself and others with 70 playing cards for a varied training program and intensive group fun. If you fail a challenge, you're out of the game — and if everyone else has dropped out, then you win.

•••

Survivor Challenge ist das erste Fitnessspiel, mit du spielerisch fit wirst! Fordere dich und andere heraus: mit 70 Spielkarten, abwechslungsreichem Trainingsprogramm und intensivem Gruppenspaß. Überall und jederzeit. Ganz ohne Geräte. Mit nur einem Ziel: Am längsten durchzuhalten und der Survivor zu werden!

Name: Iron Helm: Adventure Pack #5 – Throne of Embers
Description:
Throne of Embers is the 5th Adventure Pack for Iron Helm that adds all new Loot, Skills, Trappings, Plots, a new Boss to fight, and a new Character to play as. You will need to own the base game of Iron Helm to play this expansion.

Throne of Embers is a level two Adventure Pack meaning it is to be incorporated with the base game as your second adventure if you survive the base game.

Name: Triumphus
Description:
The Emperor is holding trials for the new party planner needed for our nation's greatest celebration - The Triumphus! Dress to impress, or end up like the last poor soul. This is the most important party of your life!

In Triumphus, you will need to use your best supplies, including wine, decorations, food, entertainment, and offerings, to gain The Emperor's rewards, which you can sell to obtain even more supplies, or hoard to gain his respect.

On your turn, you will attempt to match the supplies from the cards in your hand with the requirements on a single reward card in the community market of five cards. If you can match all of the icons on a reward, discard the supplies and take the reward, which will be valued between 4-7 points; however, the only way to get more of the necessary supplies is to sell a reward by flipping it face down and drawing as many supply cards as the card's point value. This will reduce the points for the card from face-value to only 1, so make sure you only sell rewards when you need to. And make sure you don't have more than 10 supplies at the end of your turn or you'll need to discard!

Keep up this simple loop, deciding at every turn whether you'll need an extra supply or an extra point to win. The game continues until the last reward has been collected. Count your points to see who gets the job and the favor of the high court! Every reward card you haven't sold is face-value, plus 1 additional point for each one you have sold.

—description from the designer

Name: Big 4 Football
Description:
Board and strategy  game in the colors of your favorite team (out of 4) which takes you to the heart of football league 1, with the four flagship clubs of the French football championship.

Select your players, dribble, tackle, score goals with your favorite team.

The cards of the 22 players and the coaches of the four teams (PSG, OM, ASSE, LOSC) are included in each game box.

Name: Captain Kangaroo TV Lotto
Description:
Here are your child's favorite television characters in a game he can play all by himself, or with as many as three friends.  Good practice in recognizing and completing picture - and lots of fun, too.

One Child Alone: can play Captain Kangaroo TV Lotto by spreading all 4 Master cards on table or floor and matching the Lotto pieces to the cards by putting each piece in its proper place.  Older children may like to match up the pieces by checking the numbers in the corners of the picture pieces with the corresponding numbers on the Master cards.

For Group Play: each player selects a Master card and puts it face up in front of him.

The Lotto pieces are mixed and placed face down, in a pile in the middle of the playing area.  The first player in turn lifts a Lotto piece from the pile and holds it up for all to see.  If the Lotto piece matches a section of his Master card, he places it over the matching section and has the opportunity to pick the next card from the pile.  The player continues picking from the pile until he selects a Lotto piece that does not match his Master card.

The player on whose master card the Lotto piece belongs, calls "here!" and takes it.  He places it on the right spot on his Master card and continues picking Lotto pieces until he cannot use it.

Unclaimed picture pieces are returned to the bottom of the pile and called out again at the end of the game.

The first player to complete a picture by covering his Master card with all 6 pieces is the winner.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Antilles
Description:
Trivial Pursuit Édition Antilles
2000 questions in different fields related to the Antilles:

     the geography of the West Indies,
     the history of the Caribbean,
     the Creole cuisine,
     tropical nature, 
     great sportsmen from the Antilles,
     local music...

Name: Commands & Colors: Medieval – Expansion #1 Crusades Mid-Eastern Battles I
Description:
The first expansion for Commands & Colors: Medieval.

The original plan was to have the Medieval expansions follow a somewhat historical timeline, but to keep in tune with player requests and feedback, GMT chose to jump ahead in time some 500 plus years to the Crusades. Actually reflecting on the decision, this jump makes a lot of sense, since there are marked similarities with many Byzantine battles as featured in the Medieval game and the battles fought during the Crusades gameplay wise, rule wise and transitional-thinking wise.

Yes, there are plenty of knights in shining armor in this expansion, but there are no damsels in distress or dragons to be slain. The Crusade Mid-Eastern Battles I expansion will instead focus on some of the major engagements of earlier Crusader history. In this first Crusade expansion, we showcase at least 16 Crusader scenarios and all the additional unit blocks you need to fight out these battles. New units include: Crossbow Infantry, Foot Knight Infantry, Turcopole Light Bow Cavalry, Heavy Knight Cavalry, and Heavy Military Order Knight Cavalry.

The Crusade expansion introduces many new game concepts as well: Impetuous Pursuit, Feigned Flight, Shower Shooting, and Charging Cavalry ability to pass through friendly stationary infantry units, all of which add historical depth and flavor. Still many game mechanics remain constant, like the deck of Medieval Command cards that drive movement while creating a “fog of war” and the battle dice that will resolve combat quickly and efficiently. There are also new and updated Inspired Actions for both the Crusader and Mid-Eastern armies.
 The stylized battlefield scenario maps still emphasize the important terrain features and highlight the historical deployment of forces in scale with the game system. Like your Medieval core game, the scale of the Crusade expansion is flexible and can vary from battle to battle. Yet to gain victory (and I have stated this many times before), the tactics you need to execute conform remarkably well to the advantages and limitations inherent to the various Crusader and Mid-Eastern army units, their weapons, terrain, and the history.

Name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Recursive Echoes
Description:
Recursive Echoes is a print-and-play expansion for Arkham Horror that re-imagines four familiar investigators from the board game’s core set. These “echo” investigators have been re-designed with new abilities and starting assets to further explore the unique ways these characters pursue their goals and face the growing chaos that challenges Arkham and the rest of the Miskatonic River Valley.

-description from the publisher
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)
Series: Free PnP during 2019-2020 COVID-19 Pandemic (Asmodee)

Name: Penis Camouflage
Description:
The goal of the game is to disguise an offensive image as a harmless drawing. Create a challenge by combining one of the penis stamps with a theme.

Select one player to begin as the judge. The judge stamps everyone's pad of paper, declares a theme for the round and starts the sand timer.

The players must draw quickly to transform the image before the time runs out. The judge selects a winner and a new judge is chosen. Play continues until everyone has had their fill of penises and hilarity.

—user summary

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Aaron & Eric Booster
Description:
Aaron and his boyfriend, Eric, were some of the original survivors of the Alexandria Safe-zone. The two worked together to travel what remains of D.C. and recruit lone survivors into the community. In fact, it was they who first encountered Rick’s group — earning their trust and leading them back to Alexandria.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Aaron & Eric and cards.

Aaron & Eric Character Cards for All out war and Call to arms, and the following equipment cards: Listening Device, ATV, and Shoulder-holster.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Heath Booster
Description:
Heath is an intensely intelligent member of the Alexandria community. While he often comes across as aloof, or even cynical, he is utterly dedicated to the protection of those around him. He often plays the part of a naysayer, but is not afraid to take up arms and fight when the need arises.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Heath & Spencer and cards

Card included are:

Heath and Spencer Character Cards for All out war and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards: Knapsack, Balisong and Rope.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Jesus Booster
Description:
Paul Monroe is more commonly known by his nickname – Jesus – bearing some resemblance to the biblical figure. Quick-thinking and highly skilled in unarmed combat, he is a natural survivor in the world of the walkers and valued member of the Hilltop community. Although Rick initially distrusts him when they meet, Jesus is quick to demonstrate his value and dedication –earning Rick’s trust.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Jesus & walker and cards

Card included are:
Jesus Character Cards for All Out War and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards: Leather Coat, Throwing Knives and Binoculars.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Maggie, Hilltop Leader Booster
Description:
When the violent group calling themselves the Saviors threaten the Hilltop community, Maggie Greene is the one to issue the call to arms. Ousting the previous leader, she stands alongside Rick Grimes to fight the nefarious Negan. She’s in charge now – and everyone knows it.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Maggie & Sophia and cards.

Card included are:
Maggie and Sophia Character Cards for All out War and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards: Longbow, Hilltop Spear, Hilltop Sword, Backpack, Binoculars, Aug A3, Blacksmith’s hammer, Utility belt, Throwing axe, Hilltop spear and Throwing spear.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Rick, Alexandria Leader Booster
Description:
The long road of Rick’s life hasn’t been easy, but through determination and the will to act he has held the groups of survivors together against all odds. He is now the respected leader of one of the larger settlements in the post-apocalyptic world – Alexandria – and will go to any lengths to protect those under his care.

Contains:
2 Resin Models – Rick & Walker.

Cards included are:
Rick Grimes Character Cards for All out war and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards: ATV, Knapsack, Listening Device, Rope, Concealed Blade, Hand Mirror, Shoulder-holster, Swat Battering Ram, Vektor CP1 and Music box.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – King Ezekiel Booster
Description:
Ezekiel is an eccentric and arrogant man and is the self-proclaimed ‘king’ of a community called the Kingdom. Along with his pet tiger, Shiva, he leads his group into an allegiance with Rick against Negan and the Saviors.

Contains:

     1 Resin Model
     3 Resin Markers
     Cards


King Ezekiel Character Cards for All Out War and Call to Arms, and the following equipment cards:

     Sword
     Sterling Mk6
     Kingdom Armour
     Horse
     Breastplate
     Makeshift Armour x2
     Chain

Name: Lost Worlds: Lizard Man With Scimitar and Buckler
Description:
Lost Worlds is the most popular entry in Alfred Leonardi's line of book games, which also includes Ace of Aces.  Each player has a character card and a booklet (and sometimes special Tactics, Luck, or Spell cards) for one of about fifty (and growing) medieval-fantasy characters.  Characters can range from barbarian warriors to animated skeletons to elven archers to unicorns — even two different dragons.  Booklets are traded and, as each player selects a move, a reference grid in the books determine the results (wounds, off-balance maneuvers, and so on).  Combat continues until one fighter or the other expires.

An interesting feature of the Lost Worlds system is that, under some versions of the rules, characters may improve their abilities as they gain experience.  In theory, you are supposed to keep track of your progress with each character, and if one is utterly killed, it will have to start over without its improved skills.

Part of the Lost Worlds series of books.
Families: Series: Picture Book Games (Nova Game Designs)

Name: Valda: Ragnarok
Description:
SUMMARY
Valda: Ragnarok is a an expansion to Valda. As in the base game, it is a power-building strategy game where you as a viking warchief use divine powers, manage a village and resources, play powerful spells and build temples. You gather followers, fight off enemies and climb the steps to divinity.

This expansion for Valda uncovers new treasures and new powers after the passage of the giants. 23 new cards for the base deck and 37 new god and giant cards that offer you new game mechanics and combo’s. A new card type and god, giant and treasure tokens complete this expansion.

STORY
After the arrival of the Giants, the world of Valda is on the brink of the final confrontation between the Giants and the Gods. Divine blood will flow, Gods will die, empires are about to crumble and Giants shall fall.. The end is near.

HOW TO PLAY (AND WIN)
In Valda: the Rise of the Giants, you now have a choice between Gods and Giants and their powers to use to your advantage.
When Ragnarok is played with only the base game: every player conducts 5 phases (Resource phase, action phase, building phase, attack phase and follower phase). When playing Ragnarok combined with the base game and Rise of the Giants expansion: every player finishes 4 phases during their turn (Valda phase, attack phase, follower phase and resource phase). 
In the attack phase players now can attack the player in turn or attack a God / Giant of choice. Gods and Giants are no longer immortal and untouchable.

The viking chieftan who has the most followers when the ship arrives in Asgard, becomes the new ruler of the 9 worlds! Oh.. and he/she also wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: Spell Saga: Realmwalker
Description:
Spell Saga: Realmwalker is a Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy Western drama, told through a tactical game of card-based exploration. While the main Spell Saga game spans multiple decks, and is concerned with the story of The Last Minstrel, Realmwalker games are always finished through one deck of cards and feature heroes and stories taking place in other parts of the world of Spell Saga (after it ended, of course).

—description from the publisher

Name: A Touch of Evil: The Coast – 'Haunted Shores' Game Supplement
Description:
As our Heroes return to the Coast to explore the Lighthouse, Smuggler's Cove, the Shipwreck, and the village of Tidewater, there are new encounters to be found! New creatures to fight! New items to help them in their hunt for the Villain!

This Webstore-exclusive 15-card Game Supplement for ''A Touch of Evil'' expands on Card Decks from ''The Coast'' Expansion. You must have a copy of The Coast Expansion to use these new cards. The cards are exclusive to this supplement and will not be available anywhere else. They feature new artwork and designs.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wasteland Barter Town Daily Event Pack #1 Game Supplement
Description:
Every day and night cycle in the Blasted Wastes is a deadly new adventure! Not only in the sulfurous desert wastes, but in the small settlements called Barter Towns as well. As the harsh winds whistle through the protected valleys and underground caverns that hold Barter Towns, you take refuge and re-stock your supplies, never knowing what new excitement the day will bring. Will a Burning Ship tear through the sky, exploding and raining down caustic debris, or will you be called to man the settlement walls to defend against a Sand Crab attack? You may even encounter a local junksmith erecting a huge Monolith dedicated to the Great Kraken! Yes, life is always exciting in the Blasted Wastes. Short...but exciting.

This 15-card Game Supplement for the ''Shadows of Brimstone Blasted Wastes OtherWorld'' Expansion includes a brand new set of Wasteland Barter Town Daily Event cards to liven up your Barter Town Stays. These cards form a brand new deck that introduces Daily Events to your stays in the Blasted Wastes Barter Towns between adventures in the Blasted Wastes.

You must have a copy of the Wastes OtherWorld Expansion to use this supplement.

Wasteland Barter Town Daily Events #1 is a brand new set of cards that were not previously available through any Kickstarter project.

CONTENTS

     Card #567 Dust and Wind ×4
     Card #568 Man the Walls
     Card #569 New Arrivals
     Card #570 Ghost Town
     Card #571 Burning Sky
     Card #572 "You better just watch yourself!"
     Card #573 Something in the Sand
     Card #574 Underground Detonation
     Card #575 Workshop Monolith
     Card #576 Marketplace Prices Down
     Card #577 Marketplace Prices Up
     Card #578 "Who runs the Barter Town?!"

Name: Beez: Fly, Butterfly!
Description:
A magnificent butterfly has landed gracefully in the garden. Quick! Catch up with it before it flutters away to another flower! You'll be handsomely rewarded if you do!

With the Fly, Butterfly mini-expansion, players will add butterfly tiles to replace leaf tiles from the base game and place the butterfly on one of these new butterfly tiles to start the game. Whenever a player's bee lands on a tile adjacent to the butterfly, the player will get an option to move a stored nectar to a different empty chamber without the normal restrictions. Then that player gets to move the butterfly to a different butterfly tile.

Name: Wizard School: Hank's Dirty Little Secrets
Description:
In this (not really all that safe for kids) expansion "Hank's Dirty Little Secrets" you will find quite a few things that you will not find on a store shelf. These are all the cards that Hank wrote, and then made Karen draw, but really could not be put into the core game. A fair number of references to Hank's actual high school experience, which we wouldn't call racy, but we wouldn't call tame either.

33 extra cards to add to your Wizard school deck!

Also comes with a few postcards and stickers, a giant character card, a magical wand and a « sorry » coin.

Name: Ophelia: Histories Collide
Description:
Who will history remember?Time and Space started to glitch, as the multiverse Ophelia tried to reconcile all timelines of history. Heroes triumphant throughout time are now being thrust into the heat of its defining moments, to be resettled once and for all, reforging reality.

Ophelia: Histories Collide is a game of strategy, tactics and manoeuvring, designed for intense head-to-head battles over the table. We took the drafting, strategy, bluffing and intensity of your favourite TCG games and removed all of the hassle. One box between players, endless replayability.

Players draft or use pre-constructed 21-card decks to compete for points across five rounds. Each round, players take turns to play cards and characters from the Ophelia multiverse onto the board, activating abilities and contesting lanes to swing the chances of glory in their favour.

When the dust settles, only one player will be awarded the points. The board is wiped clean, and a new round begins. When a player reaches 5 points, they are declared the victor. Otherwise, players take what resources they have left in their hand into the next round!

		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		

				
				
					Three Unique FactionsWinning is more satisfying when you win on your own terms, and with your favourite heroes of the multiverse. Take command of the mysterious and ethereal Mattervoid, the honourable Yucatec Scale-Clan, and the high-tech Animae Mechanicus, as you draft cards featuring stunning Mayan, Demonology and Mecha inspired art.

Restore history for your favourite faction, or draft a variety of characters and write your own story across Ophelia.

		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		

		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		

		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		
		

				
				
					Contents- 100 Cards (64 Unique)
- Game Mat
- 20 Page Full Colour Rulebook
- 50 Tokens

Name: Grand Battery:  Guide and Rules for Napoleonic Wargames
Description:
How would you have fared as one Napoleon's marshals, or in command of a division of redoutable British redcoats under Wellington? Grand Battery offers you the chance to find out. This book includes all the rules you need to play miniature wargames set in the Napoleonic Wars, plus plenty of useful background information you need to get started.

There is a concise historical overview of the events and battles of the period, as well as sections on the weapons and tactics of the various armies. The buyer's guide gives an up-to-date survey of the wealth of ranges of miniatures available and advice on which are compatible with which. Organizational tables give a breakdown of typical formations for all the major combatants and most of the minor ones (any one for a Wurttemburg infantry division?), allowing you to structure your collection and also to organize hypothetical games quickly with 'off the peg' orders of battle. Three historical scenarios are also included, each with their own specific orders of battle, maps, objectives and victory conditions.

The rules themselves, which utilize an innovative card-driven turn sequence to simulate the unpredictable ebb and flow of battle, are designed for playability, while still giving 'realistic' results and rewarding sound tactics. Though designed primarily for division level games with 25 or 15mm figures, the command and control sysyem takes account of corps or even the largest army level games and they are easily adaptable to any figure scale.

Get ready to march to the sound of the guns!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wargame Scenarios: The Peninsular War 1808-1814
Description:
The enjoyment of wargaming is greatly enhanced if the battles (games) are played within well thought-out scenarios. Instead of simply lining up evenly-matched armies and fighting to the death, the players can have realistic objectives (such as the capture of a vital piece of terrain or delaying a superior enemy to cover a retreat) and be confronted with more challenging tactical decisions. Devising such scenarios can take a lot of effort, and more critically, time, which is always in short supply. This book is designed to take the time and effort out of organising fascinating and challenging wargames set in the Peninsular War.

In addition to 20 carefully devised scenarios of varying size and complexity, this book contains a concise introduction to the theatre of operations and an integrated chronology of battles and campaigns, showing where the scenarios fit into the wider events. The scenarios and orders of battle are intended for use with Pen & Sword's own Napoleonic wargame rules, Grand Battery, but they are easily adaptable for use with other leading systems.

• Briefing notes on the context of the battle and the dilemmas and objectives facing each commander. Orders of battle for each side and any other information required to set up.

Contents
• Concise introduction to the Peninsular War with chronology to place the scenarios in context.
• 20 carefully devised scenarios of varying size and complexity.
• a wargamer-friendly map, showing players where to place terrain, buildings and other features that had an impact on the battlefield. It will also show initial dispositions (historical) and mark the point of entrance (or exit) of units during the battle.
• Clear win/lose/draw conditions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Drakkarmada
Description:
Drakkarmada is the world of longship raids, Viking clan rivalries, alliances and betrayals. 
Drakkarmada is also an epic adventure amidst mighty nature, facing raging elements and terrible sea monsters. 
Drakkarmada, the game of conquerors!

Goal: create the most important Armada of Drakkars, thanks to boarding parties, to alliances between Viking clans and despite, the betrayals, the losses caused by the formidable storms, the attacks of the opposing clans or those of the kraken, the terrible sea monster.

Gameplay:
Each player receive a clan and 1 alliance card.
Each player starts with a level 1 Drakkar then chooses what cards to play in order to get the longer line of Drakkars.
Events (Alliance / Kraken / betrayal of alliance...) will interfere with their plans.
Once the deck of cards is gone, the player / team with the most Drakkars win.

Name: Paupers' Ladder: One Lonely Pauper
Description:
One Lonely Pauper is a set of solo rules for Paupers' Ladder. It sees you take your Pauper and Bird companion on a Brighthelm adventure in one of these three scenarios:

Garolium's Tournament: This is the standard Paupers' Ladder game, rewritten to be played solo. Learn 3 Virtues and take your place as ruler of the realm before one of your competitors beats you to it.

The Saltash Necromancer: Freshly risen from the grave, this sorcerer has swamped  Brighthelm's cities with his undead army. Defeat them then hunt him down to his subterranean lair, but don't forget to arm yourself with the only weapon known to stop him - the mythical spirit blade.

The Fiery Siege: Dragons have attacked your home city. Stranded on the other side of Brighthelm, you must visit the arcane libraries to learn the dragonfire recipe, then make your way into your city unseen to take on the dragons from within.

Name: Simulator
Description:
The game for tacticians.

Simulator is a driving trainer for 1 to 4 players. The aim of the game is to find the ideal line on one of the four possible routes through skilful steering and choosing the right speed, i.e. to be the fastest on the course. The players can use their pieces to perform acceleration, braking and steering maneuvers. The schedule grid and the rotation of the schedule by 90 ° each result in 16 different route variants.

Name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Equipment Cards
Description:
As the name suggests, Call to Arms represents larger scale conflicts. The lone travelers struggling to survive in what’s left of the world have now formed communities, built walls, and gathered arms. However, the harsh conditions outside their walls have led these groups to fear the outside world. They see other groups as a threat to their very existence — no longer are the dead the only ones to fear.

This pack contains cards for a wide variety of weapons, armor, and other equipment that are exclusive to The  Walking Dead: Call to Arms.

These can be used to upgrade your survivors and arm them to suit your strategy in battle.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Lawful Faction Cards
Description:
As the name suggests, Call to Arms represents larger-scale conflicts. The lone travelers struggling to survive in what’s left of the world have now formed communities, built walls, and gathered arms. However, the harsh conditions outside their walls have led these groups to fear the outside world. They see other groups as a threat to their very existence — no longer are the dead the only ones to fear…

This pack contains all the rules and stats you need to use any member of the lawful factions – including the Atlanta Camp and the Greene Family.

Contents:  48 Character Cards and 12 Equipment Cards

In the Lawful pack, you’ll find rules for the following characters:


     Rick Grimes Atlanta Camp Leader

Description:
This pack contains all the rules and stats you need to use any member of the ruthless factions – including Woodbury, the Prisoners, and the Hunters.

Name: Fészekfoglaló
Description:
An exciting strategy and educational card game in which you should play your birds to different habitats, deal with special events, and score points to win the game.

In each turn, the players must choose two bird cards from their hands to play them onto the table facedown. You can choose between four different habitats (plain, forest, lake or city) to place your birds. After that, the players flip their cards to count the eggs on the bird cards. The player with more eggs wins the chosen habitat and score the points.

The game ends when one of the players scores every habitat three times. The player with the most points win the game!

—user summary

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Enemy Supplement #2
Description:
The Scafford Gang are one of the most dangerous bands of outlaws in the West! Ruthless Mutants lead by Colonel Scafford and his trusty Lieutenants, the Scafford Gang robs trains and towns across the countryside, making their hideouts in the caves and abandoned mines up in the hills. Former Confederates in the Civil War, they despise the law and use their hideous mutations to fill their pockets with gold and Dark Stone.

This set adds new large Enemy Record Sheets for 2 of the dangerous Scafford Lieutenants –Captain Burns and 'Olâ€™ One Eye' Jackson, making them full Enemy mini-bosses. It also includes new outlaw-themed Gear and Artifact cards, as well as a set of new Threat cards that combine various Scafford themed Enemies together, and even Epic Threats to face off against a more dangerous version of each of these Lieutenants with their gang.

This game supplement enhances the Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack and Dark Stone Brutes Enemy Pack, as well as the Resin Enemy Figures for Captain Burns and 'Ol’ One Eye' Jackson. Those Enemy Packs and resin Miniatures are NOT INCLUDED.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Wasteland Warmasters Enemy Supplement #1
Description:
The Wasteland Scavengers are a motley crew of criminals, cutthroats, and raiders! Brutal warriors led by powerful Warlords that don’t just want to survive in the barren and lawless wastes, but rather to thrive there! Some Warlords gain a fearsome reputation and high level of infamy from their savage exploits. These most feared Warlords are known as Wasteland Warmasters!

This set adds new large Enemy Record Sheets for 2 of the dangerous Wasteland Warmasters –Tar'Rio Gant and Celarrius Drakoth, making them full Enemy mini-bosses. It also includes new Wasteland-themed Artifact cards, as well as a set of new Threat cards that combine various Blasted Wastes themed Enemies together, and even Epic Threats to face off against a more dangerous version of each of these Wasteland Warmasters with their Scavenger crew.

This game supplement enhances the Blasted Wastes OtherWorld Expansion as well as the Resin Enemy Figures for Tar'Rio Gant and Celarrius Drakoth. That OtherWorld Expansion and those resin Miniatures are NOT INCLUDED.

Name: Nice to Meet You
Description:
"Which animal card best represents me?"
The answer you believe may not be the same one your friends think. Get to know your old friends - and new aquaintances - with a game that can bring an entirely new understanding to the way you view yourself and others.

How to play and how to win the game: Each player will have a same set of animal cards. The players take turns to draw a question card, choose one question from the card and all the players will answer that question with an animal card of their choice. Don't let the others players see which card you chose and reveal the cards at the same time. If you played the same animal card as the host (the player who drew the card), you can get a point. Talk about why you chose this card, if the host wants, they can choose a Best Answer player and give them another point. At the end of the game, the players with the most points wins.

Name: Wesołe Niedźwiadki
Description: Simple race, dice movement game from the 60s,70s? for preschool kids with nice for its time plastic tokens of bears, and events fields on the board. Nice, climatic, artistic graphics on the board. Dice is showing not the number, but colours, which shows to which field bear travels.

Name: Siege: Alexander at Tyre
Description: Siege: Alexander at Tyre is a simple wargame on the 7 months siege of the fortified city of Tyre, the city-state of Phoenicia in 332 BC by the Greco-Macedonians.
Families: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

Name: Operation Pet Scan
Description:
PRETEND YOU'RE A VET: The Operation Pet Scan game has a twist on classic Operation gameplay. Cavity Sam's dog, Rex-Ray, ate things he shouldn't have, and players need to get them out of his belly

Players use the magnet to move plastic pieces through the dog's digestive track and out the "back end" without setting off any buzzers.

—description from the publisher

Name: La Bataille de Belle-Alliance
Description: New maps and scenarios for "La Bataille der Ligny" and "La Bataile de Quatre-Bras".

Name: Trigon
Description:
Trigon is a tile placement game by Wilhelm Kienzle from 1951 and was published by Naef in 1958.
Each player gets a set of 9 similar right triangles (5 different sizes) that form a geometric sequence.
All 9 tiles together form a square with a square hole in which a cube (the die) lies.
A triangle is made up of two smaller ones in the sequence.
The side lengths of the triangle are based on the golden section.

You can find more in the book "Kurt Naef: Der Spielzeugmacher".
All tiles and the box are made of wood in high quality.

The game: A player rolls the die that dertemines a specific size, 6 meaning any choice. The player places the triangle on the table. In turn order, the other players place one of their triangles adjacent to the last played triangle with the same length (similar to the principle of domino). A player who cannot do so must pass. The player who gets rid of all his triangles wins.

In addition, mathematical facts are presented about the Golden section, the theorem of Pythagoras and about parallelograms. There a puzzles presented to be solved as well.

—user summary
